name: CLL/SLL
definition: A chronic lymphocytic leukemia that is characterized by the presence of immature lymphocytes in the blood and bone marrow and/or in the lymph nodes. [url:http\://www.cancer.gov/dictionary?CdrID=641291]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Venclexta (venetoclax) treatment resulted in a 79% (92/116) overall response rate and 20% (23/116) complete response rate in patients with either chronic lymphocytic leukemia or small lymphocytic lymphoma (PMID: 26639348).

references.title: Targeting BCL2 with Venetoclax in Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: Imbruvica (ibrutinib) is indicated in the guidelines as first line therapy and relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).

Imbruvica (ibrutinib) is indicated in the guidelines as first line therapy and relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

Venclexta (venetoclax) combined with Rituxan (rituximab) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).

Venclexta (venetoclax) combined with Rituxan (rituximab) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

Zydelig (idelalisib) combined with Rituxan (rituximab) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).

Zydelig (idelalisib) combined with Rituxan (rituximab) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).
Venclexta (venetoclax) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).
Venclexta (venetoclax) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

In a Phase II trial that supported FDA approval, Zydelig (idelalisib) treatment resulted in an overall response rate of 58% (15/26, all partial response) in patients with relapsed small lymphocytic lymphoma, with a median duration of response of 11.9 months (PMID: 24450858; NCT01282424).

references.title: PI3Kδ inhibition by idelalisib in patients with relapsed indolent lymphoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase III trial that supported FDA approval (CLL14), treatment with the combination of Venclexta (venetoclax) and Gazyva (obinutuzumab) resulted in improved progression-free survival (PFS) compared to treatment with Gazyva (obinutuzumab) plus chlorambucil ((HR 0.35; 95% CI 0.23-0.53; P<0.0001) (J Clin Oncol 37, 2019 (suppl; abstr 7502; NCT02242942).

references.title: Effect of fixed-duration venetoclax plus obinutuzumab (VenG) on progression-free survival (PFS), and rates and duration of minimal residual disease negativity (MRD-) in previously untreated patients (pts) with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL ...

evidence.efficacyEvidence: Loss of TP53 is associated with a poor prognosis in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (NCCN.org).
TP53 mutations are associated with a poor prognosis in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (NCCN.org).

The combination of Venclexta (venetoclax) and Gazyva (obinutuzumab) is indicated in the guidelines as first line therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

The combination of Venclexta (venetoclax) and Gazyva (obinutuzumab) is indicated in the guidelines as first line therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).
Calquence (acalabrutinib) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).
Calquence (acalabrutinib) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).
Copiktra (duvelisib) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).
Copiktra (duvelisib) is indicated in the guidelines as relapsed/refractory therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

In a Phase I trial, Brukinsa (zanubrutinib) treatment resulted in an overall response rate of 96.2% (75/78, 2 complete response, 63 partial response (PR), 10 PR with lymphocytosis) in patients with CLL/SLL (PMID: 31340982; NCT02343120).

references.title: Phase 1 study of the selective BTK inhibitor zanubrutinib in B-cell malignancies and safety and efficacy evaluation in CLL.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Brukinsa (zanubrutinib) treatment resulted in an overall response rate of 100% (16/16) in patients with CLL/SLL harboring del (17p) or TP53 mutations (PMID: 31340982; NCT02343120).

references.title: Phase 1 study of the selective BTK inhibitor zanubrutinib in B-cell malignancies and safety and efficacy evaluation in CLL.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: Calquence (acalabrutinib) combined with Gazyva (obinutuzumab) is indicated in the guidelines as first-line therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with TP53 loss (NCCN.org).

Calquence (acalabrutinib) combined with Gazyva (obinutuzumab) is indicated in the guidelines as first-line therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma patients with a TP53 mutation (NCCN.org).
